activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin E. Metz

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Benjamin E. Metz appeared by video. Attorney Preston James Smead appeared by video for Benjamin E. Metz. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF180, 22CF181 & 22CM131. 22CF180 & 22CF181 set for a preliminary hearing. Sowinski moves to dismiss 22CM131. Granted. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Smead willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Sowinski has complied with victim rights. Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. Bond continued. adj. 10:13 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:59 PM Defendant Benjamin E. Metz appeared by video.  Attorney Preston James Smead appeared by video for Benjamin E. Metz.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Calling 22cf180,22cf181 and 22cm131.
In receipt of all complaints, waive readings. 22cf180 and 22cf181 to be set for preliminary hearings. Time limits waived. 
9-6 PTC  for 22CM131 will come off and set for status with other cases.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 005454,
Payable Number: 108542,
Receipt Number: 22R 005281,
Amount: $20.00
Absolutely no consumption of intoxicants/No taverns or any establishment-store that serves/sells alcohol

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin E. Metz appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF180 & 22CF181. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Sowinski/Defendant statement to bail. State would like to dismiss 22CM131 - will not address bond in 22CF181 - set for initial appearance. Court sets bond in 22CF180. adj. 01:46 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
